Context

Context

Module that defines the Context dataclass for managing pandas DataFrames and metadata.

The Context class provides a structured way to store and retrieve multiple DataFrames, manage related metadata, and track DataFrame addresses.

class seroflow.context.context.Context(context_name: str, dataframes: ~typing.Dict[str, ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame] = <factory>, metadata: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>, dataframe_addr: ~typing.Dict[str, id] = <factory>)

Bases: object

A class to represent a context containing pandas DataFrames and metadata.

context_name

The name of the context.

Type:

str

dataframes

A dictionary mapping names to DataFrame objects.

Type:

Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]

metadata

A dictionary to store metadata about the context.

Type:

Dict[str, Any]

dataframe_addr

Dictionary mapping DataFrame names to their ids.

Type:

Dict[str, id]

__post_init__()

Post-initialization processing for the Context instance.

This method initializes the ‘num_dfs’ metadata to zero. Additional normalization of the context name can be added here.

__str__()

Return a string representation of the Context.

This implementation prints the context name, the dataframes, and the metadata. Note that it returns an empty string after printing.

Returns:

An empty string.

Return type:

str

add_dataframe(name, df)

Add a new DataFrame to the context and update metadata accordingly.

This method sets the DataFrame with the given name and then updates the metadata to reflect the new total count of DataFrames.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name to assign to the DataFrame.

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to add.

added_dataframe_update_metadata()

Update the metadata to reflect the current number of DataFrames.

This method updates the ‘num_dfs’ key in the metadata dictionary to match the number of DataFrames currently stored.

context_name: str
dataframe_addr: Dict[str, id]
dataframes: Dict[str, DataFrame]
delete_dataframe(name)

Delete a DataFrame from the context by its name and update metadata accordingly.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the DataFrame to delete.

Returns:

True if the DataFrame was successfully deleted, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

get_dataframe(name)

Retrieve a DataFrame by its name.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the DataFrame to retrieve.

Returns:

The DataFrame associated with the given name, or None if not found.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame or None

get_dataframe_names()

Get the names of all stored DataFrames.

Returns:

A view of the names of the DataFrames stored in the context.

Return type:

KeysView[str]

get_metadata(key)

Retrieve a metadata value by its key.

Parameters:

key (str) – The key for the metadata item.

Returns:

The metadata value associated with the key, or None if not found.

Return type:

Any or None

metadata: Dict[str, Any]
set_context_name(name)

Set the name of the context.

Parameters:

name (str) – The new context name.

set_dataframe(name, df)

Set a DataFrame in the context with the given name.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name to assign to the DataFrame.

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to store.

set_metadata(key, value)

Set a metadata value for a given key.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – The key for the metadata item.

  • value (Any) – The value to be stored.
